item.title: Dangerously loose and noisy drain cover, 10th October
item.description:
The drain cover is on the Cirencester Road, opposite Spirax Sarco's HQ and has been in this state for at least a month. It was repaired twice before, most recently only about 3 months ago. Like before, after 2-3 months the tarmac is broken up by constant traffic and chucks of tarmac and concrete get hurled into the air. It needs a different solution; maybe don't have a drain there (as there have since been 2 added just yards away) or maybe a smaller drain cover that does not stick out from the curb so much and therefore will not get as much traffic run over it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cirencester Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Land grab. The owners of 17 Farriers Reach own part of the land, but are putting in a driveway, but they do not own all the land., 10th October
item.description:
The owners of part of the land live at 17 Farriers reach but the land is on Stoke Road and is opposite Heron House (post code GL52 7RT). It also next to an electricity sub station. The issue has been reported to Tewkesbury borough council but they don't think they own the land and suggested reporting to Glos Highways. They have cut down trees and are currently excavating the land ready for a driveway
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Stretch of extremely poor road surface, 10th October
item.description:
THis is a regular problem and a more long term solution is necessary. This area of road is extremely damaged, deep puddles in wet weather makes potholes very hard to avoid, and the verges are very damaged because of people trying to cross without damage. It has needed fixing every few months for the last decade, please can it be properly resurfaced with drainage so that it's passable in winter. IT's only October, it will be impassable by Christmas
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: ALL Drains in area are blocked and causing damage during rain, 10th October
item.description:
All the drains shown on the map attached (at least 6 in the areas) are blocked. Recent heavy rain had been flowing down the road on the hill adjacent to Honeystones, making the road hazardous for driving. It is also causing erosion of the banks and curbs, loosening debris onto the road and threatening local properties of the risk of water ingress. These drains have been blocked for many months now and need properly unblocking. Some are filled up to the covering grating with debris. Please act on your responsibility to provide maintenance of the Highway, including immediately resolving the present issue, and arranging a regular series of checks and clearance routines so this problem does not continue to recur.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shipton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
